head.supplied: ¶ I have the honor by direction of the Council of the Acclimatisation Society to inform you, that at the request of Dr Mueller the Council have decided upon placing fourteen (14) of the camels at his...

div.p: L65/4150, unit 209, VPRS 3991/P inward registered correspondence, VA 475 Chief Secretary's Department, Public Record Office, Victoria.

Transcribed 17.8.93. To proof.
Letter head of the Acclimatisation Society of Victoria.
McCulloch annotated the file containing the above letter on 10 May 1865: 'I have no objection'.
See also Letter Secy Accm Socy, 11 May 65, C 203.
I have the honor by direction of the Council of the Acclimatisation Society to inform you, that at the request of Dr Mueller the Council have decided upon placing fourteen (14) of the camels at his disposal for service with the proposed Leichardt search party. Should such a course be approved of by the Government the whole of the camels will then for the present be disposed of viz six (6) to the Government of South Australia and fourteen (14) to Dr Mueller.
